trial_identification.studytitle: The Neurocognitive Sub Study of Encore1:A Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Clinical Trial to Compare the Safety and Efficacy of Reduced Dose Efavirenz (EFV) With Standard Dose EFV Plus 2N(t)RTI in Antiretroviral-naive HIV-Infected Individuals Over 96 Weeks
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Clinical Trial to Compare the Safety and Efficacy of Reduced Dose Efavirenz (EFV) With Standard Dose EFV Plus Two Nucleotide Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitors (N(t)RTI) in Antiretroviral-naive HIV-infected Individuals Over 96 Weeks
trial_identification.trialacronym: The Neurocoginitive sub study of Encore1

interventions.interventions:
Tenofovir (TDF) (300mg qd(once daily)/emtricitabine(FTC) (200mg qd) + efavirenz(EFV )(400mg qd; 2 x 200mg + 1 x placebo qd) all oral tablets
http://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT01516060?term=Encore1&rank=4
interventions.comparator: Tenofovir (TDF) (300mg qd)/emtricitabine (FTC) (200mg qd) + efavirenz(EFV )(600mg qd; 3 x 200mg qd) all oral tablets

primaryOutcome.outcome:
The primary endpoint is the comparison between neurocognitive function in patients initiating sdEFV and 400EFV
Neurocognitive function will be assessed by using a the CogState Battery, computer software designed to assess neurocognitive function

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The association between week 4 plasma EFV levels and change from baseline neurocognitive function to week 4 and 24.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All subjects entering into the main study protocol at participating centres will be eligible to enter this sub-study
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Existing neurological brain disease Recent (<6months ) head injury Current major depression or psychosis Current alcohol abuse Intended use of recreational drugs during study period Uncontrolled medical conditions deemed to potentially interfere with cognitive function (e.g. uncontrolled diabetes, pyrexial illness, uraemia etc)

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation using a randomisation table created by computer software (ie computerised sequence generation)

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Kirby Institute, Univeristy of New South Wales
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Gate 9 High Street Kennsington Univeristy of New South Wales Sydney NSW 2052

othercollaborator.othercollaboratorname: The HIV Netherlands Australia Thailand Research Collaboration
othercollaborator.othercollaboratoraddress: The Netherlands, Australia, Thailand Research Collaboration 104 Ratchdumri Road Pathumwan, Bangkok 10330, Thailand

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
The purpose is to investigate whether HIV and HIV medication can affect certain areas of brain function. This study will look at possible changes in brain function including memory, concentration and thought processes to see if there are any differences between the two doses of efavirenz used in the Encore1 study and also the level of efavirenz in the blood
http://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT01516060?term=Encore1&rank=4
